paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the Val30Met mutation in the TTR gene, focusing on its clinical implications in late- and early-onset transthyretin amyloidosis.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis, leading to severe neurological and cardiac symptoms.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in families, particularly in endemic regions.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and family history.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation is the most common variant associated with ATTRv amyloidosis.
key_quotes: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (ATTRv amyloidosis) is a clinically heterogeneous disease caused by mutations in the transthyretin (TTR) gene.
The most common mutation, Val30Met, can manifest as an early- or late-onset disease.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction focused solely on the TTR gene and its associated variant.
